item.title: By: mbrubeck
item.dc:creator: mbrubeck
item.description: It looks like this might be vulnerable to timing attacks, because of the == string comparison to check the hash in request_token_verify. You should use a constant-time string comparison to prevent this.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/07/24/stateless-csrf-tokens/#comment-4082">John Wilander</a>.
I didn't want to get into cookies for CSRF tokens. If you have multiple forms on a page you would potentially want a unique CSRF token for each form. While you could still do that using cookies, it would bit a more management.
